unnormalised: In a move that’s got more twists than a Bollywood plot, the Central Govt. has announced that linking your PAN card (that's the one with the alphanumeric code like ABCDE1234F, for the uninitiated) to your Aadhaar number (the 12-digit wonder, something like 1234-5678-9012) is now more important than finding a decent parking spot in Chandni Chowk.

unnormalised: Yes, folks, you heard it right. The deadline, which was originally set for 30/06/2023, has been extended. Again. Rumour has it, the extension was granted because half the country's population was still trying to remember their Aadhaar number, let alone link it. The new 'Do-or-Die' date is now 31/03/2024. Mark your calendars, folks, it is more important than keeping up with the latest Bollywood releases.

It'll be "inoperative," which is bureaucratic jargon for "utterly useless." So, you won't be able to file your income tax returns, open a bank account, or invest in that lucrative 'get-rich-quick' scheme your cousin keeps telling you about.
